sense.name: the removal of something unwanted, undesirable
sense.examples: The elimination of the luxury tax on boats has given a boost to the boating industry. This patented process results in the elimination of any residual impurities in the steel. Mary uses air fresheners for the elimination of household odors from pets and cooking.

sense.name: the act of excreting waste from the body
sense.examples: The patient had poor elimination from a blockage in the lower GI tract. A diet rich in fiber contributes to healthy elimination.

sense.name: a systematic rejection of alternatives
sense.examples: The evidence has forced the elimination of all hypotheses but one - Colonel Mustard killed the victim in the library with the candlestick. John avoided elimination in the chess tournament until the fourth round. The Yankees' elimination from the pennant race thrilled Red Sox fans.

sense.name: mathematical process of removing unknown variables from equations
sense.examples: This chapter shows how to solve simultaneous equations by elimination. This math software package can perform a version of Gaussian elimination.

sense.name: the murder of a rival
sense.examples: The dictator arranged for the elimination of the famous dissident scientist. The elimination of a major crime boss in New Jersey did not come as a surprise.
